docs.lead_paragraph: In this week's Your Money column, I review the big changes in the world of health insurance, banking, credit cards and student loans that are likely to affect people who are finishing school right now.

headline.main: Your Best Advice for New Graduates

docs.abstract: Readers offer financial advice for people who have recently finished school.
docs.snippet: Readers offer financial advice for people who have recently finished school.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite growing evidence that acupuncture benefits certain health conditions, most insurance companies still don't pay for it, writes Lesley Alderman in today's Patient Money column.
docs.abstract: Despite growing evidence that acupuncture benefits certain health conditions, most insurance companies still don't pay for it, writes Lesley Alderman in today's Patient Money column.
docs.snippet: Despite growing evidence that acupuncture benefits certain health conditions, most insurance companies still don't pay for it, writes Lesley Alderman in today's Patient Money column.

docs.lead_paragraph: Note to readers: My five posts this week chronicle the events of the week of Feb. 15. I'm publishing them with some misgivings, as one might get the impression that my business is days from failure at all times. Fortunately, this is not so. That week was especially nail-biting because of the timing of the payments in and out. Also, it was the beginning of an uptick in sales. From where I sit today, the recovery has begun. We now have a normal backlog of work and enough cash on hand to complete it.

headline.main: My Week in Cash Flow: Friday

docs.abstract: It still amazes me that after a phone call and a couple of e-mails people will send me a large amount of money for an item that no one has ever seen. But they do.
docs.snippet: It still amazes me that after a phone call and a couple of e-mails people will send me a large amount of money for an item that no one has ever seen. But they do.

docs.lead_paragraph: As its legal troubles mount, Goldman Sachs is losing a big corporate client: the American International Group.
docs.abstract: The American International Group is turning to Citigroup and Bank of America to replace Goldman Sachs as the main corporate adviser as the insurer reorganizes.
docs.snippet: The American International Group is turning to Citigroup and Bank of America to replace Goldman Sachs as the main corporate adviser as the insurer reorganizes.

headline.seo: A.I.G. Is Said to Replace Goldman as Top Adviser

docs.lead_paragraph: A challenge to the federal Defense of Marriage Act, which defines marriage as being between a man and a woman, was heard in federal court.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Thursday Reading: Getting Paid for Shopping and Sharing

docs.abstract: People who get paid for shopping and sharing, the status of health insurance premiums for the middle class and other consumer-focused items from Thursday's Times.
docs.snippet: People who get paid for shopping and sharing, the status of health insurance premiums for the middle class and other consumer-focused items from Thursday's Times.

headline.main: Will Premiums Fall for the Middle Class?

docs.abstract: In 2014, people who receive insurance through their employers but pay more than 9.5 percent of their income in premiums will be able to purchase insurance on the exchanges instead.
docs.snippet: In 2014, people who receive insurance through their employers but pay more than 9.5 percent of their income in premiums will be able to purchase insurance on the exchanges instead.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite his reputation for hard-charging and profanity-spiced intensity, Rahm Emanuel has long kept a circle of loyal aides, both as a congressman and now as White House chief of staff. But he is about to lose the adviser who has been closest to him: Sarah Feinberg is leaving to join Bloomberg L.P. as a communications strategist.

headline.main: Rahm Emanuel Is Losing a Key Aide

docs.abstract: Sarah Feinberg is leaving the White House to join Bloomberg L.P. as a communications strategist.
docs.snippet: Sarah Feinberg is leaving the White House to join Bloomberg L.P. as a communications strategist.
